author: Special Correspondent
text:
Residents of localities near Kasipalayam in Erode seeking a halt to eviction of encroachers along canal embankments on Monday.- PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Residents of Kalyanasundaram Street, Vaikalmedu, appealed to the district administration on Monday to temporarily halt the move to evict them from the embankments of Nanjai Uthukuli irrigation canal.

Petition

In a petition to the Collector S. Prabakar, the residents said they feared for the future of their wards, who are to appear for the SSLC and Plus Two public examination.

Dislocation at this juncture would affect their studies, and hence, the encroachment-eviction move by the Public Works Department must be kept in abeyance till the completion of this academic year, C. Manikandam, a resident, emphasised. According to a notice served to the residents by the Public Works Department, they were living unauthorisedly on the embankments, and had to vacate and shift their valuables and belongings within seven days. If not, the materials would be confiscated.
title: Kalyanasundaram Street residents appeal against eviction notice
